lore.mechanization.multimeter.2: Shift+%s to toggle redstone control state
lore.mechanization.upgrade.2: Must have a Machine Upgrade installed
lore.mechanization.machine_crafting_tabl: Enables crafting advanced machines and items.
block.mechanization.reinforced_structura: Block of Raw Reinforced Structural Alloy
block.mechanization.super_conductive_raw: Block of Raw Super Conductive Alloy
lore.mechanization.item_filter.1: Right click on a chest with
item.mechanization.disc_end_of_the_world: Skeeter Davis - The End of the World
mech.manual.title_page:
The ultimate guide to everything Mechanization.

      Datapack By:
     ImCoolYeah105
mech.manual.mechanical_manual.body: The guide book to Mechanization. If you lose yours, you can craft a new one. Hover over the crafting table icon to see the recipe. You can click on the crafting table icon to pin the recipe, showing it in the manual's lore.
mech.manual.app_base_desc: Everything you need to get started.
mech.manual.app_machines_desc: Unlock new machines to progress through Mech and automate your world.
mech.manual.app_nuclear_desc: Build nuclear reactors for big power.
mech.manual.app_gadgets_desc: Craft overpowered tools and weapons using your hard earned resources.
mech.manual.app_assembly_desc: Automate everything with item pipes, auto crafting, and mass storage.
mech.manual.app_tcc_desc:
Loads The Creeper's Compendium if The Creeper's Code is installed.
3rd party datapack by _CreeperMagnet et cetera.
mech.manual.app_accessory_bag_desc:
Loads Accessory Bag's manual if installed.
3rd party datapack by Asdru22.
mech.manual.app_simplenergy_desc:
Loads SimplEnergy's manual if installed.
3rd party datapack by Stoupy51.
mech.manual.app_stardust_fragment_desc:
Loads Stardust Fragment's manual if installed.
3rd party datapack by Stoupy51.
mech.manual.getting_started.title: Getting Started
mech.manual.getting_started.body1:
1. Collect resources: ores (including the new Tin), wool, glass, and some others.
2. Make a Machine Crafting Table. This is used for all crafting in Mech.
3. Make Wrench and Multimeter. These are important tools for interacting with machines.
mech.manual.getting_started.body2:
4. Make some Copper Cables to transfer power between machines.
5. Make a basic power generator. The Steam Generator is the best for beginners.
6. Make any Tier 1 machine you want! The Alloy Furnace is a good start as it's needed to progress.
mech.manual.machine_crafting_table.title: Machine Crafting Table
mech.manual.machine_crafting_table.body: The most important block in Mech, used to craft everything else in the datapack.
mech.manual.wrench.title: Wrench
mech.manual.wrench.body:
Breaking Mech machines normally will destroy them! To break them safely, Shift+Right Click with the wrench.
Additionaly, you can Right-Click with the wrench to modify a machine (ussually rotates it).
mech.manual.multimeter.title: Multimeter
mech.manual.multimeter.body:
Right Click on a machine with the multimeter to get detailed information about it, like how much power it has stored.

Shift+Right Click to toggle the redstone control state.
mech.manual.gps.title: GPS
mech.manual.gps.body:
Shift+Right Click to save current location to the GPS.

Right Click on a machine (like the Teleporter) to transfer to coords to the machine.
mech.manual.muffler_upgrade.title: Muffler
mech.manual.muffler_upgrade.body: The Muffler completely silences all noise created by a machine. Sneak+Right click on a machine to install.
mech.manual.rods.title: Rods
mech.manual.rods.body: Rods are a crafting component used in various items and machines. They can also be made more efficiently with a Casting Basin.
mech.manual.plates.title: Plates
mech.manual.plates.body: Plates are a crafting component used in various items and machines. They can also be made more efficiently with a Casting Basin.
mech.manual.gears.title: Gears
mech.manual.gears.body: Gears are a crafting component used in various items and machines. They can also be made more efficiently with a Casting Basin.
mech.manual.tier_1_machine_frame.title: Tier 1 Machine Frame
mech.manual.tier_1_machine_frame.body: Crafting component used to make Tier 1 Machines.
mech.manual.tier_2_machine_frame.title: Tier 2 Machine Frame
mech.manual.tier_2_machine_frame.body: Crafting component used to make Tier 2 Machines.
mech.manual.tier_3_machine_frame.title: Tier 3 Machine Frame
mech.manual.tier_3_machine_frame.body: Crafting component used to make Tier 3 Machines.
mech.manual.tier_1_battery.title: Tier 1 Battery
mech.manual.tier_1_battery.body:
Capacity: 50,000 kJ

Batteries store any extra energy produced by generators that machines aren't using. Neat!
mech.manual.tier_2_battery.title: Tier 2 Battery
mech.manual.tier_2_battery.body:
Capacity: 200,000 kJ

Batteries store any extra energy produced by generators that machines aren't using. Neat!
mech.manual.tier_3_battery.title: Tier 3 Battery
mech.manual.tier_3_battery.body:
Capacity: 500,000 kJ

Batteries store any extra energy produced by generators that machines aren't using. Neat!
mech.manual.quantum_battery.title: Quantum Battery
mech.manual.quantum_battery.body:
Capacity: 200,000 kJ

Quantum Batteries share their energy pool, similiar to how an Ender Chest shares items. They are linked when set to the same Grid ID.
mech.manual.copper_cable.title: Copper Cable
mech.manual.copper_cable.body:
Transfer Rate: 256 kW

Cabling is used to transfer power between machines. Simply place a line of cables connecting the machines.
mech.manual.conductive_cable.title: Conductive Cable
mech.manual.conductive_cable.body:
Transfer Rate: 2048 kW

Cabling is used to transfer power between machines. Simply place a line of cables connecting the machines.
mech.manual.super_conductive_cable.title: Super Conductive Cable
mech.manual.super_conductive_cable.body:
Transfer Rate: Infinite kW

Cabling is used to transfer power between machines. Simply place a line of cables connecting the machines.
mech.manual.vial.title: Vial
mech.manual.vial.body: Vials hold liquid like a bucket, but they can also hold gasses like Steam. Additionally, they can hold any amount of liquid up to 1 bucket, which makes them useful for emptying machines with liquid stuck in their tanks. You can also drink from them...
mech.manual.energy_relay.title: Energy Relay
mech.manual.energy_relay.body: Energy Relays are great for sending energy long distance -  up to 48 blocks. They have 2 modes: 'send' and 'receive' - toggle with a wrench.
mech.manual.machine_upgrade.title: Machine Upgrade
mech.manual.machine_upgrade.body: Machine Upgrades can be added to most machines. Generally increases power or efficiency, but sometimes unlocks entire new abilities! Visit each machine's page to see what the upgrades do.
mech.manual.ender_upgrade.title: Ender Upgrade
mech.manual.ender_upgrade.body: Ender Upgrades are and additional enhancement that can be added to any machine that already has a Machine Upgrade. Generally increases efficiency, but sometimes unlocks entire new abilities!
mech.manual.nether_upgrade.title: Nether Upgrade
mech.manual.nether_upgrade.body: Nether Upgrades are and additional enhancement that can be added to any machine that already has a Machine Upgrade. Generally increases power or speed, but sometimes unlocks entire new abilities!
mech.manual.progression.title: A Note on Progression
mech.manual.progression.body1: To advance beyond Tier 1 machines, you need to create advanced alloys (like Steel) in the Alloy Smelter. This requires melting some metals in the Arc Furnace and using Liquid Pipes (or vials) to transport the molten metal into the Alloy Furnace.
mech.manual.progression.body2: Most alloys require 2 types of molten metal, and a 3rd solid ingredient. Once combined, the Alloy Furnace outputs a new molten alloy. Use Liquid Pipes to transport this into a Casting Basin, and cast the alloy into ingots.
mech.manual.steam_generator.title: Steam Generator
mech.manual.steam_generator.body: The Steam Generator creates steam from water and fuels like wood and coal. You can use Pipes and a Liquid Accumulator to supply water. When the steam tank is over half full, the steam is converted into energy.
mech.manual.alloy_furnace.title: Alloy Furnace
mech.manual.alloy_furnace.body: The Alloy Furnace is 1 of 4 machines need to make Alloys. It combines basic materials into advanced metals required to craft Tier 2 and 3 machines. Pipe output liquids into a Casting Basin to convert molten metal into ingots.
mech.manual.alloy_furnace.ender_upgrade: Tier 2 Alloys cost 10%% less to make
mech.manual.alloy_furnace.nether_upgrade: Tier 3 Alloys cost 10%% less to make
mech.manual.tier_2_alloys.title: Tier 2 Alloys
mech.manual.tier_3_alloys.title: Tier 3 Alloys
mech.manual.liquid_pipe.title: Liquid Pipe
mech.manual.liquid_pipe.body: Transports liquids between machines- 1 of 4 devices needed to make Alloys. Generally, the top and bottom output liquid, and the sides input liquid (if a machine only inputs or outputs, all sides do that respectivly).
mech.manual.tier_1_liquid_tank.title: Tier 1 Liquid Tank
mech.manual.tier_1_liquid_tank.body: Liquid tanks store liquids like water. You can add or remove liquids by placing Vials, Buckets, and Glass Bottles in the top left slot of the GUI. The Wooden Liquid Tank cannot hold hot liquids or gasses.
mech.manual.tier_2_liquid_tank.title: Tier 2 Liquid Tank
mech.manual.tier_2_liquid_tank.body: Liquid tanks store liquids like water. You can add or remove liquids by placing Vials, Buckets, and Glass Bottles in the top left slot of the GUI. The Hardened Liquid Tank can hold hot liquids, but not gasses.
mech.manual.tier_3_liquid_tank.title: Tier 3 Liquid Tank
mech.manual.tier_3_liquid_tank.body: Liquid tanks store liquids like water. You can add or remove liquids by placing Vials, Buckets, and Glass Bottles in the top left slot of the GUI. The Pressurized Liquid Tank can hold both hot liquids and gasses.
mech.manual.thermoelectric_generator.bod: The Thermoelectric Generator creates power by combining a hot and cold liquid, like water and lava. The hotter & colder the liquids, the more power it outputs. The liquids are consumed in the process.
mech.manual.thermoelectric_generator.end: Can create power without a coolant, at reduced efficieny.
mech.manual.thermoelectric_generator.net: Can create power without a hot liquid, at reduced efficieny.
mech.manual.liquid_temps.title: Liquid Temperatures
mech.manual.arc_furnace.title: Arc Furnace
mech.manual.arc_furnace.body: The Arc Furnace is 1 of 4 machines needed to make Alloys, and is the first machine in the process. It melts resources into their molten forms- ie. Iron Ingots are melted into Molten Iron, which can be used in the Alloy Furnace to create Steel.
mech.manual.arc_furnace.ender_upgrade: +33%% bonus output from raw metals (Raw Iron), but can only process raw metals.
mech.manual.arc_furnace.nether_upgrade: +25%% Speed, +25%% Efficiency, but can only melt non-metals (ie. Diamond).
mech.manual.casting_basin.title: Casting Basin
mech.manual.casting_basin.body: The Casting Basin is 1 of 4 machines needed to make Alloys, and is the last step in the process. It converts liquids into ingots, blocks, rods, plates, gears, and more. Select the desired output type in the UI.
mech.manual.casting_basin.machine_upgrad: -1 ingots to cast rods, plates, and gears.
mech.manual.casting_basin.ender_upgrade: -2 ingots to cast rods, plates, and gears.
mech.manual.liquid_accumulator.title: Liquid Accumulator
mech.manual.liquid_accumulator.body: Pulls liquid from the world, allowing them to be Piped to other locations and used in machines. Collects source blocks, liquid from cauldrons, milk from cows, or even XP from players above 30 levels. You can drink Liquid XP from Vials to get it back.
mech.manual.electric_furnace.title: Electric Furnace
mech.manual.electric_furnace.body: The Electric Furnace acts exactely like a normal furance, except it used power to smelt items instead of fuel.
mech.manual.tree_feller.title: Tree Feller
mech.manual.tree_feller.body: The Tree Feller chops any tree in fron of it and dumps all the wood behind it.
mech.manual.tree_feller.machine_upgrade: Replants nearby sapling on the ground in front of the Tree Feller.
mech.manual.tree_feller.ender_upgrade: Chops mega trees, ie. Spruce and Jungle.
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.title: Growth Accelerator
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.body: When placed underneath farmland, the Growth Accelerator will speed up the growth rate of any bonemealable crop above it.
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.machine_u: Works on some non-bonemealable crops, like nether wart.
mech.manual.growth_accelerator.ender_upg: Affects a 3x3 area above it instead of a single block.
mech.manual.block_breaker.title: Block Breaker
mech.manual.block_breaker.body: The Block Breaker is an hovering entity that does not have a physical presence. It will break any block inside of it.
mech.manual.block_breaker.machine_upgrad: Can break harder blocks like obsidian and ores.
mech.manual.block_breaker.nether_upgrade: Breaks blocks in a 3x3x3 area instead of a single block.
mech.manual.grinder.title: Grinder
mech.manual.grinder.body: The Grinder breaks down resources into basic parts. For example, Ores and Ingots are ground into raw metals, Cobblestone into Sand, Blaze Rods into Blaze Powder, Bones into Bonemeal, Logs into Planks, etc.
mech.manual.grinder.nether_upgrade: Output is smelted- ie. Cobblestone -> Sand is instead Cobblestone -> Glass
mech.manual.solar_panel.title: Solar Panel
mech.manual.solar_panel.body: The Solar Panel converts energy from the sun into energy for free. Right click the panel to switch to lunar mode, which generates power from the moon instead.
mech.manual.solar_panel.ender_upgrade: +50%% Efficiency during peaks hours, +100%% Efficiency during off hours (morning/evening)
mech.manual.solar_panel.nether_upgrade: +200%% Efficiency, but only generates power during peak hours.
mech.manual.bio_generator.title: Bio Generator
mech.manual.bio_generator.body: The Bio Generator converts organic matter into power. The more unique items are supplied, the higher to total power output (reacting carrots and potatos generates more power than either alone).
mech.manual.bio_fuels.title: Bio Fuels
mech.manual.bio_fuels.body1:
4 kW: Cactus
4 kW: Melon Slice
8 kW: Sugar Cane
8 kW: Kelp
8 kW: Bamboo
12 kW: Sweet Berries
12 kW: Cocoa Beans
12 kW: Beetroot
12 kW: Potato
12 kW: Carrot
16 kW: Wheat
16 kW: Raw Cod
16 kW: Raw Salmon
mech.manual.bio_fuels.body2:
16 kW: Pumpkin
16 kW: Apple
20 kW: Melon Block
20 kW: Nether Wart
20 kW: Raw Rabbit
20 kW: Raw Chicken
24 kW: Raw Beef
24 kW: Raw Porkchop
24 kW: Raw Mutton
24 kW: Mushrooms
24 kW: Chorus Fruit
28 kW: Fungi
32 kW: Hay Block
32 kW: Chorus Flower
mech.manual.quarry.title: Quarry
mech.manual.quarry.body: The Quarry mines up to a 30x30 area down to bedrock. To setup a Quarry, build a rectangular area with fences, replace one of the corner fences with the Quarry, and right click with a wrench. The Quarry can be disabled with a redstone signal.
mech.manual.auto_farm.title: Auto Farm
mech.manual.auto_farm.body: The Auto Farm harvests and replants crops in a 7x7 area. Can be turned off with redstone.
mech.manual.auto_farm.machine_upgrade: Collects dropped items and places them on top of the Auto Farm.
mech.manual.auto_farm.nether_upgrade: Decreases range to 3x3, but harvested crops drop double items.
mech.manual.auto_fisher.title: Auto Fisher
mech.manual.auto_fisher.body: The Auto Fisher collects fishing loot automatically. It must be placed in the center of a 5x5x5 pool of water. Can be turned off with redstone.
mech.manual.auto_fisher.machine_upgrade: Enables collecting treasure drops, like enchanted books.
mech.manual.auto_fisher.ender_upgrade: Fishes with Luck of the Sea 3
mech.manual.item_reformer.title: Item Reformer
mech.manual.item_reformer.body: The Item Reformer can repair any item at the cost of power and Liquid Experience.
mech.manual.mob_grinder.title: Mob Grinder
mech.manual.mob_grinder.body: The Mob Grinder kills all mobs in a 7 block radius and collects their drops. If upgraded, it outputs Liquid Experience on its bottom side. Can be turned off with redstone.
mech.manual.mob_grinder.machine_upgrade: Collects XP from killed mobs in the form of Liquid Experience.
mech.manual.mob_grinder.ender_upgrade: Killed mobs drop player only items.
mech.manual.electric_lamp.title: Eletric Lamp
mech.manual.electric_lamp.body: The Electric Lamp lights up an area with a 30 block radius- twice that of Glowstone. Requires redstone power.
mech.manual.super_piston.title: Super Piston
mech.manual.super_piston.body: The Super Piston is like a normal piston, but can move Tile Entities and Machines. Does not work with slime/honey blocks.
mech.manual.super_sticky_piston.title: Super Stick Piston
mech.manual.super_sticky_piston.body: A sticky varient of the Super Piston.
mech.manual.turn_table.title: Turn Table
mech.manual.turn_table.body: The Turn Table 'right clicks with a wrench' any block above it. This can be used to rotate blocks, switch machine states, or activate a Quarry.
mech.manual.dimensional_generator.title: Dimensional Generator
mech.manual.dimensional_generator.body: The Dimensional Generator extracts Essence of Minecraft from rare items and converts it into power. The rarer the item, the more power provided. Initially can only extract power from items found in the Overworld.
mech.manual.dimensional_generator.ender_: Can extract power from items found in The End.
mech.manual.dimensional_generator.nether: Can extract power from items found in The Nether.
mech.manual.overworld_fuels.title: Overworld Fuels
mech.manual.overworld_fuels.body:
15s: Blue Ice
20s: Prismarine Crystals
40s: Rabbit Foot
80s: Phantom Membrane
160s: Scute
240s: Nautilus Shell
500s: Music Disc
1000s: Heart of the Sea
2000s: Totem of Undying
mech.manual.ender_fuels.title: Ender Fuels
mech.manual.ender_fuels.body:
4s: End Stone
8s: Purpur Block
40s: Ender Pearl
60s: Eye of Ender
80s: Dragon's Breath
250s: End Crystal
500s: Shulker Shell
2000s: Dragon Head
8000s: Elytra
mech.manual.nether_fuels.title: Nether Fuels
mech.manual.nether_fuels.body:
4s: Nether Brick
10s: Soul Sand
40s: Magma Block
40s: Glowstone Dust
80s: Nether Quartz
80s: Blaze Powder
250s: Ghast Tear
500s: Wither Rose
2000s: Wither Skeleton Skull
6000s: Nether Star
mech.manual.lightning_generator.title: Lightning Generator
mech.manual.lightning_generator.body: When a Lightning Rod placed on top of the Lightning Generator is struct, and infinite amount of power is briefly created. The power only lasts for 1 second, more Capacitors = more power collected.
mech.manual.teleporter.title: Teleporter
mech.manual.teleporter.body: Right click the Teleporter with a Multimeter that has saved coords to set the destination. Then, simply stand on the teleporter to travel there instantly!
mech.manual.enchanting_station.title: Enchanting Station
mech.manual.enchanting_station.body: At the cost of power and Liquid Experience, the Enchanting Station will combine the enchantments of an Item and an Enchanting Book. Can be upgraded to Disenchant by combining an item with a regular book.
mech.manual.enchanting_station.machine_u: Allows creating some invalid enchantment combinations.
mech.manual.spawner_controller.title: Spawner Controller
mech.manual.spawner_controller.body: When placed on a Mob Spawner, the Spawner Controller regulates the spawner, making it more predictible, and increasing the required player range. Also allows the Mob Spawner to be disabled with redstone.
mech.manual.spawner_mover.title: Spawner Mover
mech.manual.spawner_mover.body: The Spawner Mover is a 1 time use item that can pick up and move a spawner. Great when paired with the Spawner Controller.
mech.manual.nuclear_physics.title: A Note on Nucler Physics
mech.manual.nuclear_physics.body: Fission Reactors in Mech are very complicated, and can explode if unmanaged. It is difficult to fit all the relavant information in a book, so consider using the [wiki] instead.
mech.manual.centrifuge.title: Centrifuge
mech.manual.centrifuge.body: The Centrifuge refines nuclear fuel rods into higher grades. Insert a fuel rod by right clicking on top of the centrifuge, then wait a few minutes. The higher the grade, the hotter a reactor will run, but the more power you can get.
mech.manual.uranium_fuel_cell.title: Uranium Fuel Cell
mech.manual.uranium_fuel_cell.body: Uranium fuel cells are the basic starter fuel type. Refine in a centrifuge to power a Fission Reactor (at least 10%% refined).
mech.manual.plutonium_fuel_cell.title: Plutonium Fuel Cell
mech.manual.plutonium_fuel_cell.body: Plutonium is the byproduct of nuclear reactions. Fuel Cells made from Plutonium are slightly more controllable than Uranium.
mech.manual.spent_fuel_cell.title: Spent Fuel Cell
mech.manual.spent_fuel_cell.body: After all the fuel in a Fuel Cell is depleted, it is converted into a Spent Fuel Cell. Put this in a Centrifuge to turn it into Plutonium.
mech.manual.fission_reactor.title: Fission Reactor
mech.manual.fission_reactor.body: The Reactor Block is the heart of any reactor. Insert Fuel Cells to generate heat. Send this heat into a 5x5 area of metal blocks to generate steam (see wiki).
mech.manual.steam_turbine.title: Steam Turbine
mech.manual.steam_turbine.body: Steam Turbines limit how much power the reactor can produce. If the reactor generates more steam than the turbines can handle, the power is wasted. Having more turbines than steam has no effect.
mech.manual.control_rod.title: Control Rod
mech.manual.control_rod.body: Agrueably the most important block- the Control Rod disables a Fission Reactor block directly above it when powered by redstone. This will cause the 'Reaction Rate' to decrease (but 'Temperature' keeps going up!)
mech.manual.temperature_observer.title: Temperature Observer
mech.manual.temperature_observer.body: The Temperature Observer outputs a comparater signal based on how hot the nearest reactor is. Use this to activate a Control Rod at high Temperatures.
mech.manual.reaction_rate_observer.title: Reaction Rate Observer
mech.manual.reaction_rate_observer.body: The Reaction Rate Observer outputs a comparater signal based on the 'reaction rate' (how quickly the reactor is heating up) of the nearest reactor is. Use this to activate a Control Rod at high reaction rates.
mech.manual.tinker_table.title: Tinker Table
mech.manual.tinker_table.body: The Tinker Table is used to apply upgrades to the Energy Saber, Drill, Modular Armor, and EPAC. Place the item you want to upgrade in the available slot, then place the upgrades in the new slots that appear.
mech.manual.charging_station.title: Charging Station
mech.manual.charging_station.body: The Charging Station powers any items that can store power- specifically the Portable Battery and any item upgraded with Portable Batteries. Insert an item by right click on the black square on top of the Charging Station.
mech.manual.portable_battery.title: Portable Battery
mech.manual.portable_battery.body: The Portable Battery stores energy which provides power to upgrades and tools while it's in your hotbar. Can also be applied to Modular Armor as an upgrade, allowing the Modular Armor to store energy.
mech.manual.energy_saber.title: Energy Saber
mech.manual.energy_saber.body: The Energy Saber is a melee weapon that can be upgrades with Rods (ie. Iron Rod) at the Tinker Table. Every Rod has a unique effect- try them all! Can be thrown with right click when upgraded. Can also be dyed any color.
mech.manual.energy_saber_effects.title: Upgrade Effects
mech.manual.energy_saber_effects.body1:
>Throw Range: how far the saber can be thrown with right click
>Reinforced: absorbs durability damage done to other rods
>Poison: inflicts poison on hit
>Wither: inflicts wither on hit
>Weakness: inflicts weakness on hit
mech.manual.energy_saber_effects.body2:
>Slowness: inflicts slowness on hit
>Vampiric: heal on hit
>Illuninating: targets glow on hit
>Repair: absorbs durability damage done to other rods and repairs them
mech.manual.drill.title: Drill
mech.manual.drill.body: The Drill is a powerful multitool that can mine almost any block. Apply Gears (ie. Iron Gear) at the Tinker Table to upgrade the Drill. Every Gear as unique effects- try them all!
mech.manual.drill_effects.title: Upgrade Effects
mech.manual.drill_effects.body1:
>Mining Speed: how fast the drill mines
>Mining Area: how many additional blocks are broken
>Reinforced: absorbs durability damage done to other gears
>Auto Smelt: mined blocks are smelted, as if by a furnace
mech.manual.drill_effects.body2:
>Trash: destroys mined junk blocks
Magnetic: attracts dropped items
>Aquatic: mine faster underwater
>Illuninating: creates light in dark places
>Repair: absorbs durability damage done to other gears and repairs them
mech.manual.modular_helmet.title: Modular Helmet
mech.manual.modular_helmet.body: The Helmet of the Modular Armor set. Can be upgraded with Plates (ie. Iron Plate) at the Tinker Table. Each Plater has a unique effect- try them all!
mech.manual.modular_chestplate.title: Modular Chestplate
mech.manual.modular_chestplate.body: The Chestplate of the Modular Armor set. Can be upgraded with Plates (ie. Iron Plate) at the Tinker Table. Each Plater has a unique effect- try them all!
mech.manual.modular_leggings.title: Modular Leggings
mech.manual.modular_leggings.body: The Leggings of the Modular Armor set. Can be upgraded with Plates (ie. Iron Plate) at the Tinker Table. Each Plater has a unique effect- try them all!
mech.manual.modular_boots.title: Modular Boots
mech.manual.modular_boots.body: The Boots of the Modular Armor set. Can be upgraded with Plates (ie. Iron Plate) at the Tinker Table. Each Plater has a unique effect- try them all!
mech.manual.armor_effects.title: Upgrade Effects
mech.manual.armor_effects.body1:
>Shield Capacity: uses power to generate a shield which reduces damage by 80%% for <capacity> hits
>Reinforced: absorbs durability damage done to other plates
>Illuminating: makes you glow
mech.manual.armor_effects.body2: >Repair: absorbs durability damage done to other plates and repairs them
mech.manual.plasma_weapon.title: Extreme Plasma Annihilater Cannon (EPAC)
mech.manual.plasma_weapon.body: The EPAC is a powerful ranged weapon that fires intense blobs of plasma. It's components can be swapped out at the Tinker Table to create unique effects.
mech.manual.rebreather.title: Rebreather
mech.manual.rebreather.body: The Rebreather provides infinite water breathing at the cost of power provided from a Portable Battery. Can be added to the Modular Helmet.
mech.manual.night_vision_goggles.title: Night Vission Goggles
mech.manual.night_vision_goggles.body: Night Vision Goggles provide infinite night vision at the cost of power provided from a Portable Battery. Can be added to the Modular Helmet.
mech.manual.hover_boots.title: Hover Boots
mech.manual.hover_boots.body: Hover Boots provide infinite slow fall, activating after falling a short distance, at the cost of power provided from a Portable Battery. Can be added to Modular Boots.
mech.manual.phase_boots.title: Phase Boots
mech.manual.phase_boots.body: Phase Boots allow running straight throw thin walls at the cost of power provided from a Portable Battery. Safety not guaranteed. Can be added to Modular Boots.
mech.manual.jetpack.title: Jetpack
mech.manual.jetpack.body: The Jetpack enables stable flight- look up to go up, and down to go down. Comes with a built in Elytra- look down and press space to activate. Can be added to Modular Chestplate.
mech.manual.long_barrel.title: Long Barrel
mech.manual.long_barrel.body: The Long Barrel Increases projectile velocity and range, making them fly further faster. Removes the default bouncing projectile effect. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.split_barrel.title: Split Barrel
mech.manual.split_barrel.body: The Split Barrel split outgoing projectiles into 9 individual projectiles, turning the EPAC into a shotgun. DPS is unchanged. Disables default bouncing projectiles. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.sonic_barrel.title: Sonic Barrel
mech.manual.sonic_barrel.body: The Sonic Barrel has a short range but pierces targets and adds +50% damage, at the cost of +300% heat. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.overclocked_pump.title: Overclocked Pump
mech.manual.overclocked_pump.body: The Overclocked Pump increases total DPS, at the cost of additional heat. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.frigid_pump.title: Frigid Pump
mech.manual.frigid_pump.body: The Frigid Pump decreases total DPS, but significantly decreases heat. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.accelerated_chamber.title: Accelerated Chamber
mech.manual.accelerated_chamber.body: The Accelerated Chamber fires extremely quickly with little damage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.rapid_chamber.title: Rapid Chamber
mech.manual.rapid_chamber.body: The Rapid Chamber fires very quickly with reduced damage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.pressurized_chamber.title: Pressurized Chamber
mech.manual.pressurized_chamber.body: The Pressurized Chamber fires slower with increased damage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.blazing_chamber.title: Blazing Chamber
mech.manual.blazing_chamber.body: The Blazing Chamber fires very slowly with high damage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.supercharged_chamber.title: Supercharged Chamber
mech.manual.supercharged_chamber.body: The Supercharged Chamber fires extremely slowly with very high damage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.energized_heat_sink.title: Energized Heat Sink
mech.manual.energized_heat_sink.body: The Energized Heat Sink reduces the EPAC's heat output at the cost of additional power ussage. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.passive_heat_sink.title: Passive Heat Sink
mech.manual.passive_heat_sink.body: The Passive Heat Sink decreases power ussage at the cost of increases heat output. Apply at a Tinker Table.
mech.manual.compressor.title: Compressor
mech.manual.compressor.body: The Compressor can compact any item by following 2x2 and 3x3 recipes. (ie. 9 Iron Ingots -> Iron Block). Great for automating melon farms.
mech.manual.decompressor.title: Decompressor
mech.manual.decompressor.body: The Decompressor reverses the Compressor, taking a compact item and converting it into its origonal parts (ie. Iron Block -> x9 Iron Ingots).
mech.manual.stone_cutter.title: Stone Cutter
mech.manual.stone_cutter.body: The Stone Cutter carves stone into new shapes- for example Stone in Stone Bricks. Great for automating production of building supplies.
mech.manual.dye_machine.title: Dye Machine
mech.manual.dye_machine.body: The Dye Machine can apply a dye to any dyeable block in batches of 8. For example, 8 orange wool + 1 purple dye = 8 purple wool.
mech.manual.auto_jukebox.title: Auto Jukebox
mech.manual.auto_jukebox.body: When given a redstone signal, the Auto Jukebox will play a random music disc in its inv. Neat! It may even be able to play something... unnatural ;)
mech.manual.fast_hopper.title: Fast Hopper
mech.manual.fast_hopper.body: The Fast Hopper acts like a normal hopper, but transfers items x5 faster.
mech.manual.ender_hopper.title: Ender Hopper
mech.manual.ender_hopper.body: The Ender Hopper acts like a normal hopper, but also teleports all items in a 12 block radius into its inventory.
mech.manual.item_pipe.title: Pnuematic Tube
mech.manual.item_pipe.body: Pneumatic Tubing is used to link Pnuematic Entry and Exit Points, allowing for the fast and efficient transfer of Items.
mech.manual.item_extractor.title: Pnuematic Entry-Point
mech.manual.item_extractor.body: Pneumatic Entry-Points pull items from blocks and send them to connected Exit-Points. When applicable, will only pull from valid output slots like the Furnace output slot.
mech.manual.item_inserter.title: Pnuematic Exit-Point
mech.manual.item_inserter.body: Pneumatic Entry-Points accept items sent by Exit-Points and insert them into a block. Will only insert into valid slots, and will ignore 'fake' slots many Mech machines have.
mech.manual.item_filter.title: Item Filter
mech.manual.item_filter.body: To use the Item Filter, put the whitelisted items in a chest and shift+right click on the chest with the Item Filter. Then, right click on a Pneumatic Entry or Exit points to add the filter.
mech.manual.storage_unit.title: Unlimited* Storage Unit
mech.manual.storage_unit.body: The Unlimited* Storage Unit can hold up to the signed 32-bit integer limit (~2 bil) of a single item. Great for storing all that cobblestone- or melon...
mech.manual.mss_drive_bay.title: MSS Drive Bay
mech.manual.mss_drive_bay.body: The MSS Drive Bay houses storage drives, allowing the MSS Terminal to access them. Any number of Drive Bays can be used in a system, but ussually 1 is enough.
mech.manual.mss_storage_drive.title: MSS Storage Drive
mech.manual.mss_storage_drive.body: The MSS Storage Drive stores the items inserted into the MSS. It has 24 item slots, each holding ~2 bil of a single item. Must be access using the Terminal.
mech.manual.mss_terminal.title: MSS Terminal
mech.manual.mss_terminal.body: The MSS Terminal will load Storage Drives in nearby Drive Bays, allowing you to access the items. Items can be inserted into the MSS at any time using the empty slot. Who needs chests am I right?
mech.manual.simplenergy.title: SimplEnergy X-Compat Features
mech.manual.florcraft.title: Florcraft X-Compat Features
mech.manual.tcc.title: The Creeper's Code X-Compat Features
mech.manual.simplunium.title: Simplunium Ore
mech.manual.simplunium.body: Mech machines can process Simplunium Ore any way a normal ore can be processed. Also has rods, plates, and gears for upgrading equipment.
mech.manual.magic_alloy.title: Magic Alloy
mech.manual.magic_alloy.body: Arid, Aqueous and Verdant Alloys from Florcraft can be processed into rods, plates, and gears for upgrading equipment. Grants the same abilities as Florcraft's upgraded tools, and +20% magic resist on armor of their type.
mech.manual.amethyst_dust.title: Charged Music Discs
mech.manual.amethyst_dust.body: The Auto Jukebox can play charged music discs, which affect the weather.
mech.advancements.mechanization.title: Mechanization
mech.advancements.mechanization.desc: Create a Machine Crafter to get started in Mechanization.

mech.advancements.one_manual.desc: Use the Mechanical Manual to referance the manual from a 3rd party datapack.
